text: House Passes Matsui’s Clean Tech Manufacturing and Export Promotion Legislation
label: BODY

text: Key Component of ‘Make it in America’ Agenda will Create Jobs, Support Sacramento’s Growing
label: BODY

text: Clean Energy Sector
label: BODY

text: WASHINGTON, DC – Today, the House of Representatives passed legislation introduced by Congresswoman
label: BODY

text: Doris Matsui (CA-05), H.R. 5156, the Clean Energy Technology Manufacturing and Export Assistance Act of 2010, which
label: BODY

text: would boost the competiveness of the U.S. clean technology industry in both domestic and international markets.  The
label: BODY

text: legislation received bipartisan support and passed by voice vote.
label: BODY

text: “Providing clean energy entrepreneurs with the tools they need to sell their products in new markets and increase
label: BODY

text: their production will have substantive multiplier effects on our communities and our economy as a whole,” said
label: BODY

text: Congresswoman Matsui.  “As part of the Make it in America Agenda, H.R. 5156 will help put families back to work
label: BODY

text: and strengthen America’s manufacturing sector.  Investing in American-made technology and products is a clear
label: BODY

text: path to economic recovery, renewed financial stability, and measurable job growth.”
label: BODY

text: The Clean Energy Technology Manufacturing and Export Assistance Act is part of the “Make it in America”
label: BODY

text: Agenda introduced last week by Rep. Matsui, House Majority Leader Steny Hoyer (MD-05), Dean of the House John
label: BODY

text: Dingell (MI-15), and other Members of Congress committed to reviving America’s manufacturing sector and
label: BODY

text: creating good-paying American jobs.  The Make it in America Agenda is a manufacturing strategy based on the idea that
label: BODY

text: when more products are made in America, more people will be able to make it in America.  The Make it in America
label: BODY

text: Agenda creates incentives for investment in industry, will strengthen manufacturing infrastructure and innovation, and
label: BODY

text: helps to level the playing field for American companies that compete globally.
label: BODY

text: “Our national manufacturing strategy creates the high-skill, high-wage jobs of the future by promoting American
label: BODY

text: competitiveness, innovation, and exports,” added Rep. Matsui.  “As the Department of Energy reports,
label: BODY

text: clean energy technology exports could increase by $40 billion per year and create more than 750,000 jobs by 2020.
label: BODY

text: Passage of my legislation will help the Sacramento region seize this opportunity to create new jobs and position
label: BODY

text: ourselves as a clean tech capital.”
label: BODY

text: H.R. 5156 would create a $15 million Clean Energy Technology Manufacturing and Export Assistance Fund to support
label: BODY

text: the development, implementation, and sustainability of a National Clean Energy Technology Export Strategy, and assist
label: BODY

text: U.S. clean tech firms by finding and navigating foreign markets to export their goods and services abroad.  The Matsui
label: BODY

text: legislation would also strengthen America’s domestic clean tech manufacturing industry by promoting policies that
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: will reduce production costs and encourage innovation, investment, and productivity in the clean energy technology
label: BODY

text: industry here at home.
label: BODY

text: According to the Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee, more than 30 percent of non-exporting small and medium
label: BODY

text: sized companies would export if they had more access to market information, export opportunities, and the export
label: BODY

text: process.  The Clean Energy Technology Manufacturing and Export Assistance Act will provide the assistance many U.S.
label: BODY

text: small businesses are seeking.
label: BODY

text: “Currently, our nation is running a trade deficit in green technologies ranging in the billions,” Rep. Matsui
label: BODY

text: said today on the House floor during consideration of H.R. 5156.  “Our nation should not be dependent on foreign
label: BODY

text: energy which threatens our national security, hurts our environment, and weakens our economy.  We must be the world
label: BODY

text: leader in manufacturing and export American-made clean energy technologies.”
label: BODY

text: The Clean Energy Technology Manufacturing and Export Assistance Act was introduced by Rep. Matsui on April 27,
label: BODY

text: 2010 and passed unanimously out of the Commerce, Trade and Consumer Protection Subcommittee on June 30, 2010.
label: BODY

text: It was passed with broad support in the full Energy and Commerce Committee on July 21, 2010.
label: BODY
